intro: Viola adunca var. minor, commonly known as the lesser violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, featuring heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, violet-blue flowers with five petals, blooming from late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in woodland habitats. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
